comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: See earlier photo (the plants are smaller) with the Garden Palace in the background - From the John Lane Mullins album at SLNSW - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=836375

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] A great find and a good way to date the photo using the size of plants. 

AB

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw] I am not good with plant growth rates, but I would say this photo is 5 years after the older one, so c.1885. Which implies that the whole Botanic Gardens set might be earlier dates than I thought. There is one favourite of mine (I think not yet on flickr) which shows the Garden Palace (1879-82) clearly in the background, and a man doing clever things with a hose (?!) - investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/photo.asp... .
